c74object.name: ta.printerror
c74object.description: Similar to print but it displays error messages (with red background) to the max window .

inlet.digest: Anything to be Printed in Max Window

objarg.name: identifier
objarg.description: The first argument is an identifier for the ta.printerror object. Each message printed in the Max window is preceded by the name of the ta.printerror object. The name can be either a number or a word. If there is no argument, error messages will be displayed without the identifier. Using an argument to ta.printerror can help distinguish the output of two or more ta.printerror objects.

objarg.name: gate
objarg.description: The second argument argument (de)activates ta.printerror. 0 : deactivate/ignore messages in left inlet; 1 : activate/print error messages to Max window. (default = 1)

method.name: anything
method.digest: Print error to the Max window
method.description: In left inlet messages are not interpreted by the ta.printerror object. They are simply printed verbatim in the Max window.

method.name: int
method.description: In right inlet non-zero number will activate ta.printerror so it can send error messages to the Max Window. While a "0" number will deactivate ta.printerror, ignoring all messages received in the left inlet.

entry.name: anything
entry.description: There are no outlets. The message received in the inlet is printed in the Max window.
